meanings.definition: To create or perform spontaneously without preparation.
meanings.sent1: She decided to improvise a song for her friends.
meanings.sent2: The actors had to improv a scene when the prop broke.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to improv a new dish when the main ingredient ran out.
meanings.sent4: His speech was like an improv dance, flowing freely and unpredictably.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes were an improv of colors and shapes on the canvas.

meanings.definition: A performance or activity that is improvised.
meanings.sent1: The improv at the comedy club had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent2: She signed up for an improv class to improve her spontaneity.
meanings.sent3: The improv group always brought joy to the audience with their quick wit.
meanings.sent4: The meeting turned into an improv session as they brainstormed ideas.
meanings.sent5: The street performer's improv with passersby drew a crowd.
